message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of estimating a vector from noisy measurements using a prior specified only through a denoising function. This problem is relevant in a range of imaging tasks, which suggests that the paper could belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of convolutional neural network (CNN) denoisers, which further supports this possibility. However, the paper's focus on regularization and optimization methods suggests that it could also belong to the information theory (cs.IT) or numerical analysis (cs.NA) sub-categories. The paper's use of plug-and-play priors and regularization-by-denoising (RED) methods suggests that it could belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) or signal processing (cs.SI) sub-categories as well. Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.NA, and cs.SI, in that order.
